laboratory_examinations.findings: Initially showed elevation of transaminases, which progressively improved until normalization at 6 years of age.
Normal echostructure and size of both kidneys.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At 6 years of age, bilateral increased echogenicity was present, with poor corticomedullary differentiation and hyperechoic thickening of the adipose tissue of the bilateral perirenal space.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Areas of gliosis with encephalomalacia, diffused hypo/delayed myelination, irregularity of the subependymal surface, thinned corpus callosum, dilation of the lateral ventricles, thinned appearance of the middle and anterior cerebral arteries, and trigonocephaly.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Another MRI at age 8 showed multiple aneurysms in various cerebral arteries, occlusion of the M1 segment of both middle cerebral arteries, and irregular and stenotic appearance of the A3-A4 segments of the anterior cerebral arteries associated with Moyamoya disease.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Multiple bone anomalies, including bone age delay (1 year and 3 months at a chronological age of 3 years and 10 months), dislocation of the humeral ossification center, convex shape of the radius bilaterally, and bilateral subluxation of the femoral heads.
